name: Research Assistant (Volunteer, Remote)
description: Creshendo is a nonprofit organization dedicated to empowering displaced populations through psycho-social support, resilience-building, and cultural preservation. Our research agenda is focused on identifying and addressing the unique challenges faced by refugees, ensuring their voices are heard, and fostering inclusive, resilient communities. As we expand our research department, we are seeking a Research Assistant to support the development of long-form research papers on refugee issues for publication. This role will work closely with our Data Analyst to conduct research, gather sources, and assist in structuring key findings for reports and academic publications. The Research Assistant will play a key role in supporting the research department by assisting in data collection, literature reviews, stakeholder engagement, and research planning. This position is ideal for someone with a background in research, social sciences, public policy, or a related field who is passionate about refugee issues and wants to contribute to evidence-based solutions. The role will involve collaborating on Creshendo’s Research Agenda, assisting in writing and structuring long papers, and helping to build a comprehensive research framework that contributes to refugee protection, integration strategies, and advocacy efforts. ● Literature Review & Data Collection: Assist in reviewing existing studies on refugee issues, displacement trends, and protection risks. ● Research Support: Gather qualitative and quantitative data to support long-form publications on refugee challenges and policy recommendations. ● Stakeholder Collaboration: Engage with internal teams, refugee representatives, and academic partners to align research priorities. ● Survey & Methodology Assistance: Support the development of surveys, interviews, and mixed-method research approaches to collect meaningful insights. ● Writing & Structuring Reports: Help organize research findings into structured reports, supporting the Data Analystin preparing papers for publication. ● Project Tracking & Documentation: Maintain records of sources, research priorities, and upcoming publication deadlines. ● A background in research, social sciences, public policy, migration studies, or a related field. ● Strong analytical, writing, and organizational skills. ● Experience conducting literature reviews, qualitative or quantitative research, or data collection. ● Familiarity with academic research methods and data analysis tools (preferred but not required). ● Passion for human rights, refugee issues, and evidence-based advocacy. ● Availability to dedicate at least 6-10 hours per week. ● Impact: Contribute to meaningful research that informs refugee policy and protection strategies. ● Skill Development: Gain hands-on experience in nonprofit research, data collection, and academic writing. ● Networking: Work with researchers, policymakers, and humanitarian professionals in an international setting. ● Flexible Role: Remote position with the ability to collaborate across time zones. Learn more about our  mission at   www.creshendo.org. Certificates and recommendation letters are available upon successful completion.

name: Sales, Promotions, Fundraising, and Sponsorship Drive Volunteers Needed
requirements: Must be committed to Justice At Last’s mission to empower trafficked persons.
description: As we gear up for our 10 Year Celebration event taking place on October 26, 2025 we need volunteers to help us with selling tickets, promoting our event, securing corporate and law firm sponsorships, helping with fundraising and or soliciting donations for a silent-auction, to help create awareness about our "Celebrating 10 Years of Justice" event. Experienced volunteers will assist in developing an effective and comprehensive fundraising and marketing strategy for Justice At Last. Volunteers with limited experience will help support staff and Board members with outreach to current donors to increase donor engagement, soliciting new donors as well as corporate and law firm sponsorships, and help generate overall awareness about human trafficking and the anti-trafficking work Justice At Last does. This role is virtual and a great opportunity to get involved in the anti-trafficking movement and help support trafficked persons seeking justice on their own terms. Most of the work for this volunteer position is virtual/working remotely. Volunteers must have experience in sales, soliciting sponsorships and donations, promotions and marketing strategies, social media, virtual communication or a willingness and comfort with learning to do those tasks.  Must also b committed to Justice At Last’s mission to empower trafficking victims by providing access to free comprehensive legal services, advocacy and specialized training to help transform survivors’ lives. Justice At Last is the only nonprofit law firm in the San Francisco Bay Area exclusively serving the legal needs of survivors of human trafficking. We provide clients with free legal services regardless of their age, sex, gender identity, abilities and equity needs, nationality or type of trafficking. We provide free legal representation that emphasizes dignity and is survivor-centered, culturally sensitive, trauma informed, and rights-based. Our specialization includes assertion of crime victims' rights, clearing criminal records, family law, immigration relief and identity theft recovery. While we have satellite offices in the Bay Area, our practice is mobile and we travel to where the client is already receiving services to save them time, money and to ensure survivors are in a space that feels safe and trusted.

name: Content Manager
description: The KeelWorks foundation is developing training, internal communication, social media, and web marketing. We are currently looking for a writer with some newsletter background to help us shape KeelWorks monthly newsletter. Looking for enthusiastic learner who can write professionally and with an interesting take on nonprofits. Our mission is to get people to work. We espectially focus on supporting economic parity. Our values are Honesty: Transparency, integrity, and a commitment to truth. Competence: Building for individual empowerment and mutual value. Diversity: Full inclusion with equality and dignity for all. Community: Mutual support: together, we can do anything! Leadership: Leading with integrity for the benefit of all. Our behavior will reflect our values. The Cause In this world there are the haves and the have nots. The haves come to the table, the have nots are on the outside looking in. It is easy to believe that we, with our sterling education, excellent job, good society, and more money than we really need, have these because we deserve them. And that those without these are without them because they simply didn’t work for it. We believe life is more complicated than that. Given different circumstances, those on the inside and those on the outside might be reversed. We believe everyone has something essential to contribute. We believe inclusion makes for a more peaceful world. We believe we CAN foster sustainable and measured change. We think today’s needy can be the helpers of tomorrow. Change is difficult, often because we are scared, ignorant, ill-equipped, and alone. KeelWorks addresses these factors for greater success. Our special "sauce" is: address the barriers, arm with basic competencies, provide the savvy of lessons learned, and provide a community of mutual support and accountability for as long as it takes. KeelWorks has no religious or political affiliation. We believe diversity, in all its forms, breeds perspective, and the learning is better for it. Rich and poor, intellectually advantaged and intellectually challenged, black, indigenous, asian, white, Muslim, Jew, Catholic, Hindu, or atheist; the broader the base, the better. We can help the unemployed create jobs where no jobs exist, we can help the displaced workers and homemakers reinvent themselves, we can help refugees from incarceration, tyranny, and poor choices redefine themselves for better futures. We can do this - only with your help. , please fill out this application: https://forms.gle/YA8xXiNJVEWmtLn39

name: Volunteer Caseworker
requirements:
Volunteers must be UK based.
Volunteers will need to visit beneficiaries, in-person, within their local area.
description: This is a UK volunteering opportunity, all volunteers must currently live in the UK. We need Volunteer Caseworkers in different locations across the country. As a Caseworker you will only ever be asked to visit clients within your local area, at a time to suit you. To find out if we need Caseworkers in your local area please visit our website and use the volunteer vacancy search tool. Caseworkers visit clients to work out what type of support they need. You will listen without judgement to assess and provide tailored support to help those serving, who have served and their families to navigate life in and beyond military service. Some examples of support are securing funding for special equipment for someone with a disability, adaptions to a property so an older client can remain at home or funds for a rental deposit. Caseworkers also sign-post clients onto specialist local services for advice on benefits, housing, mental health, debt, finding work etc. We’ve been supporting the Armed Forces community since 1885. Our clients come from all backgrounds and age groups and may have served in WW2 or in a more recent conflict like the Falklands or Afghanistan. We’d love the general public to understand what we do and how they can help us. There are SSAFA branches throughout the UK and overseas who support local volunteers to deliver services to veterans, serving personnel and their families. Some branches are divided into smaller divisions to ensure the best local service delivery. Each branch has a team of volunteer caseworkers, support volunteers, executive roles, and fundraisers. Volunteer Caseworkers are the lifeblood of SSAFA, supporting a growing number of people in need of financial, practical, and emotional support. Clients come from all backgrounds and age groups and may have served in WW2 or in a more recent conflict like Iraq or Afghanistan. The essential part of the role is visiting clients, so you will need access to a vehicle or another way to travel to meet clients at home or in a care home setting. As part of your local branch, you might have access to an office, but you can complete the administration part of the role from home as long as you have access to IT equipment and the internet. We welcome volunteers of all backgrounds, abilities, races, sexual orientations, socio-economic backgrounds, and of all faiths and none. SSAFA are committed to making reasonable adjustments to support volunteers with disabilities, so they have access to the same opportunities and experiences as volunteers who do not. 18 SSAFA undertakes a systematic approach and utmost care at every step of the process of volunteer recruitment, selection, and retention to ensure that those recruited are suitable and appropriate. Measures taken at points along this journey work together to make volunteering at SSAFA a positive and safe experience. Yes .  We will ask for two character references, this can be a former employer or someone that know you well (other than a relative  ) Yes, this is provided by SSAFA at no cost to the potential volunteer. This role requires an enhanced check (including checks against the children and adults barred list)

name: Virtual Assistant~ Tech Content Creator
description: Over the past year, I’ve been working on a mission that matters deeply to me: helping African and Asian professionals take their place in the age of AI. Many have been left out of global conversations, not because they lack talent, but because they lack context, access, and strategic support. I’ve run free bootcamps and coached aspiring tech professionals. Now, I’m building a long-term system designed to unlock AI opportunities at scale, without relying on traditional gatekeepers or expensive platforms. While I won’t share all the details yet, I’m assembling a small team of focused content volunteers to help bring it to life. You’ll help gather and format powerful content - real-world AI tools, short videos, trends, and case studies - based on specific prompts. Your work will empower others. This is a mutually beneficial opportunity that lasts 9 weeks. What You’ll Do: You’ll be assigned a set of short tasks (per week) that involve: Finding helpful short videos, charts, and online tools Summarizing specific trends and examples. Sourcing articles, walkthroughs, or practical how-tos Curating resources for different modules in our AI Bootcamp You will be reporting to a guide throughout the 9 week period. What You’ll Gain: Credibility: You’ll build real content inside a high-value AI product Proof of Work: This work is CV- and portfolio-worthy AI-Focused Content Portfolio: You’ll work closely on cutting-edge content that speaks to today’s tech economy. LinkedIn + Career Endorsement: Upon completion, I’ll personally recommend you on your LinkedIn profile and any other job platform of your choice. Data & AI Mentorship (optional): I’ll give you access to weekly mentorship that involves getting personalised 1-hr per week mentorships on Data while you expand your knowledge when sourcing the content. You Should NOT Apply If: You disappear without warning. You can’t commit to delivering high quality content during the project duration (though we’ll show you how) You need daily handholding to complete tasks. People who work well independently are invited. What’s Required: A smartphone or laptop (recommended) with stable internet Ability to use Canva, ChatGPT, Google, YouTube and Docs. Ability to follow clear, structured tasks and meet deadlines Ability to communicate via Telegram and WhatsApp Willingness to learn and grow within a supportive culture. Would you love to join us? Kindly hit the volunteer button. There’ll be a lot of communication during the first week. By then, everything will be clear. If you’re interested, respond, and I’ll reach out personally, send you a short form-then we can begin our communication from there. Please note: I want you to succeed in this volunteering opportunity. To do that, you'll need to respond to the email when sent, be apt to respond on Telegram and be a good communicator. You will receive a response in one to four days after applying. Keep checking your mail. God bless you!

name: Volunteer Onboarding Coordinator
organizationName: Carboncopies Foundation for Substrate Independent Minds INC
requirements: Commitment of 5-10 hours per week for at least 6 months
description: The Carboncopies Foundation is an international nonprofit organization dedicated to advancing the science and technology of whole brain emulation - the process of transferring the structure and functions of a brain from its original substrate to another computational substrate of a neural prosthesis. Founded by neuroscientists and technologists, we serve as a nexus for research collaboration, education, and public discourse on the path toward preserving and extending human cognition. Our work spans multiple disciplines including neuroscience, computer science, nanotechnology, and philosophy. Through workshops, webinars, publications, and community building, we bring together researchers, students, and enthusiasts who share our vision of developing technologies that may one day allow for the precise mapping and functional recreation of neural architectures. We believe that whole brain emulation represents not only a profound scientific challenge but also a potential pathway to extending human experience, knowledge, and consciousness beyond current biological limitations. For over 15 years, we have been at the forefront of research and development in this field, fostering collaboration between leading neuroscientists, technologists, and visionaries who share our mission. Our efforts have been powered by a dedicated community-over 100 volunteers have contributed to our initiatives over the years, with 30+ actively driving our programs forward today. As a Volunteer HR Recruiter at the Carboncopies Foundation, you will play a vital role in building our diverse team of talented contributors who share our vision for advancing whole brain emulation technology. You will assist in managing the influx of applications from prospective volunteers and interns, ensuring a smooth and efficient recruitment process. This position offers a unique opportunity to help shape the human capital of an organization at the cutting edge of neuroscience and technology while developing valuable skills in nonprofit human resources management. Commitment of 5-10 hours per week for at least 6 months If our mission resonates with you, we encourage you to get involved. To apply for a volunteer position, please send your resume and a brief statement outlining your interest to  onboarding@carboncopies.org with "Volunteer Onboarding Coordinator" in the subject line. Alternatively, apply through our form at:  https://carboncopies.org/apply The Carboncopies Foundation is committed to diversity and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

name: Foster to Forever Representative
description: This is a remote opportunity! At Four Paws of Hope, safety and security of an animal is one of our top priorities and strive to foster long lasting relationships between humans and animals. But we also understand life happens and to no one's fault an animal needs to be rehomed. However, many people post on social media to rehome their pets. Unfortunately, more likely than not, unless you personally know the person, your pet is going to end up in an unsafe situation. This program was created to help pet owners vet potential adopters and assist with a safe transition that would act in the best interest of the pet. With this program, the pet is able to stay in their home until a verified adopter is found to minimize stress and anxiety on the animal and avoid multiple transitions. Therefore, Four Paws of Hope needs Foster to Forever representatives to verify owner surrender applications and vet potential adopters. Please see responsibilities below. - Reviewing owner applications to be a part of the foster to forever program. - Updating the website with the available pets for adoption as well as information about the pet - Advertising the pets to social media rescue groups - Reviewing potential adopter applications, this will include checking vet and landlord references where applicable - Sending and receiving signed contracts from all parties - Facilitating safe meeting locations for owner and approved adopter to meet to transfer pet

name: Administrative Assistant
organizationName: CHRISTLIKE AGRO-TOURISM FOR RACIAL EQUALITY WELLNESS CENTER &SERVICES
description: DEPARTMENT:Administration ROLE TITLE:Administrative Assistant REPORTS TO: Strategic Planner/CEO LOCATION: Remote/Olympia, Washington State LEVEL/SALARY: Volunteer DESIRED HOURS: Monday through Saturday, Part-time Flexible Hours ORGANIZATION DESCRIPTION: C.A.R.E. Wellness Center & Services C.A.R.E. Wellness Center is a 501(c)3 nonprofit charity with a mission of providing a safe farm stay, holistic retreat, and wellness programs for BIPOC community and allies for equality. Its programs are focused on persons of color and work with vulnerable populations such as BIPOC with justice-involvement, foster youth, and those suffering mental health challenges. The person in this role must be sensitive to these populations and center their duties on wellness. Our Mission is to provide a safe farm stay, holistic retreat, and wellness programs for black, indigenous, people of color and allies, to recover from Post-Traumatic Slave Syndrome via Spirituality, AgroTourism, and Racial Justice. Our Vision is Connectivity: to Nature; to God; and to Self. Our goal of acquiring farmland is to establish a safe spiritual retreat for people of color to escape constant trauma and begin repairing their fractured foundation and realize self-actualization. Our programs are a research community project with a goal of empowering others to heal from PTSS. The Founder, Chair, and CEO is a woman of color, Pansexual, and person with disabilities fully committed to the growth of both C.A.R.E. Wellness Center (nonprofit) and C.A.R.E. Family Services, LLC (for-profit), also doing direct services for children and youth. We highly encourage an ethical, organized, and ambitious student or seasoned professional to help support the foundation of this new and unique nonprofit for the community. This is a home-based office welcoming volunteers, guests, and visitors for meetings while fundraising for farmland to headquarter wellness programs. JOB SUMMARY: The Administrative Assistant Volunteer at C.A.R.E. Wellness Center will play a pivotal role in supporting our nonprofit’s mission to foster a community dedicated to wellness, spirituality, and social justice. This position is ideal for someone who is detail-orientated, has administration experience, and is passionate about organization development and community service.As an Administrative Assistant Volunteer, you will be the backbone of our day-to-day operations, ensuring smooth and efficient administrative support. Your contributions will directly impactour ability to serve our community effectively.Remote opportunities for a Washington state resident. RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide administrative support to the CEO, board of directors, and C.A.R.E. team, contributing to the development and implementation of organizational strategies. Answer and direct main phone calls, serving as the first point of contact for the center. Manage the master calendar, including scheduling and coordination of wellness programs and events. Prepare and distribute meeting announcements, agendas, and minutes, ensuring timely communication within the team. Assist in the creation and maintenance of filing systems, both electronic and physical. Support the team in various projects related to mental health, trauma, meditation, and self-advocacy. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: - Types 35+ WPM - Excellent oral, text and written skills. - Manage the clerical assistants who will support departments and programs with projects and tasks. - Organization Development: Assist in establishing administrative processes and systems that enhance the center’s operational efficiency. - Communication: Serve as a liaison between staff, volunteers, and community members, maintaining clear and open channels of communication. - Time Management: Oversee the master calendar to ensure that all events, meetings, and deadlines are met without conflicts. - Documentation: Accurately record and maintain documentation of meetings and center activities. - Calendar Coordination: Manage the master calendar, and stay abreast of financial, program, and marketing calendars. - Team Collaboration: Work closely with other departments to support their objectives and integrate their needs into organizational development and structure. - Community Engagement: Engage with the local and online community to foster relationships and partnerships that promote wellness and mental health awareness. PROGRAMS USED: - Microsoft Suite - Notion CRM - Slack & Yodel - Office Machinery - Canva and print jobs - Calendly and event booking sites WORK CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: The Administrative Assistant worksflexible shifts remotely with some scheduled time in the office, meeting and event settings during quarter sessions for programs, with minimal bending, stooping, sitting, and kneeling. May requirelong periods of standing. Exposure to animals, plants, perfume/incense, and nuts. May require infrequent lifting up to 50 lbs. May require some local travel. QUALIFICATIONS: Residency in Washington State with a willingness to volunteer on-site as needed. Excellent verbal and written communication abilities. Proficient in using office software and technology for virtual collaboration. Previous experience in administrative roles or nonprofit organizations is a plus. Strong organizational skills, attention to detail,and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Commitment to the values of C.A.R.E. Wellness Center & Services. C.A.R.E. Wellness Center is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all stakeholders. NEXT STEPS: Please Apply HERE! https://forms.gle/TEe1B5c7krmZxRap7

description: In 1982, angels led us on a route called, Christmas Star, to a beautiful desert mountain valley where we built a church. On the first day of Advent, December 5, 1982, the chapel was completed and dedicated, simply, to God. That's what the sign out front says, a church to God, all faiths welcome. What's it about? Bringing peace on earth, good will to men and woman - one by one, one heart at a time. Unfortunately, no one hears about it or the angels who come. But this church is not to take anyone from his or her faith or way of knowing God (by whatever name they may call Him). It is about learning together and being at peace with our neighbors. Sounds simple? But right now, the way people are divided, that's probably why no one comes. Heaven on earth can begin one by one, and two by two. Want to come? It would be beautiful if someone heard the angels loving message. "We have come but for one purpose, and that is to prepare a way for the coming of the Messiah." See https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1boGeX3umrLouZ8cCQzBNr10chgLwe9jOiKPsN1xyxEE/edit?usp=sharing or the Association of Universal Philosophy on Facebook. Would you like to help angels gather a flock -- Not to take people from their own churches, temples, synagogs, or mosques, but simply to add to what they already know? We are asked to love God one-tenth as much a He loves us, and to love one another in the same manner. In this way, we will be building a temple of God within our hearts, and thus upon the Earth. For the temple is not a building, it is being built within each man and woman. It is how a way will be prepared for the coming of the Messiah on Earth. "New words shall be written upon the sky, but they must be written in men's hearts first," the angels say. Want to volunteer?

description: Please join us on National Night Out to sign up people to be community Relationship Builders, and enjoy yourself also with the fun activities we will have on that day. National Night Out is Aug 5th, we'll be setting up at around 1PM, event starts at 4pm. We are living in a crazy world today. More and more children are growing up in broken homes, homicides are crazy high, too many people continue to be homeless, etc. We need to do better at meeting the needs of the people, and we need to meet them where they are. For that reason, we’ve been working with community leaders and RPD to came up with a system of check -ins. We do this by going out speaking with community members, asking them to simply make calls to 3-5 of their friends or family members in the area once a month to check up on them. The goal of the check-ins is to help people at their most vulnerable times. Hurt people, hurt people. The best way to fight violence that comes from hurt people hurting people, is to get help for them before they spread the hurt. It hurts to be depressed, lonely, angry, etc. With our check-ins we want to be able to get resources to people before things become detrimental to themselves, their families and the community. So, I hope you will join us. You could be the first step in making a hugh difference in someones life.

description: The Hope Project for Kids is a newly established nonprofit dedicated to supporting families with children diagnosed with rare diseases. We provide critical resources, advocacy, and emotional support to families navigating the challenges of rare diseases. Our mission is to empower families by connecting them with information, resources, and a community of support. As we grow and work toward providing even more impactful services, we are seeking passionate and dedicated individuals to join our . This is a great opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of children and families who need it most. As a of The Hope Project for Kids, you will be part of a dynamic team focused on guiding the strategic direction of the organization, ensuring its sustainability, and advocating for families with children facing rare diseases. We are seeking individuals who have a deep commitment to our mission and bring diverse skills and experiences to the table. This is a volunteer, non-paid position, with an expected time commitment of . Participate in setting and executing the nonprofit’s long-term strategic plan. Ensure the organization’s financial health, adherence to legal and regulatory standards, and alignment with its mission and vision. Assist in identifying potential funding sources and help cultivate relationships with donors, sponsors, and key community stakeholders. Represent the nonprofit in the community and at fundraising or advocacy events, helping to raise awareness about the needs of families with rare diseases. Offer insights into program development and improvement to better serve families affected by rare diseases. We are looking for board members with expertise in the following areas (but not limited to): (specifically in rare diseases, pediatrics, or healthcare advocacy) (experience with nonprofit financials, fundraising campaigns, or donor relations) (experience with nonprofit law, governance, or contract management) (experience working with underserved populations, public policy, or advocacy work) (experience in nonprofit marketing, public relations, or social media engagement) Be part of a team that is changing lives for families with children facing rare diseases. Gain valuable nonprofit leadership experience and work alongside passionate professionals. Build relationships with other professionals in the nonprofit, healthcare, and advocacy sectors. While this is a volunteer position, we understand that you may have other commitments, and we aim to work around your schedule. If you are interested in making a difference in the lives of children with rare diseases and believe you can contribute to The Hope Project for Kids, please send your resume or LinkedIn profile along with a brief statement of interest outlining why you would like to be involved and what you can bring to the board. We look forward to hearing from you!

name: Youth Mental Health Nonprofit Seeks Volunteer Judges for Film and Art Contests
requirements: Approximately 1-2 hours per contest. Judging can be completed at the volunteer's convenience within the judging window and does not have to be completed in one session. This is a virtual volunteering opportunity.

Email and internet access are required to participate, as is some interest in at least one of the following areas: mental health, suicide prevention, visual art, filmmaking, education, youth, entertainment, public health.
description: Youth Creating Change believes in the true power of young people. Combining arts-based curricula and a commitment to youth empowerment, our programs facilitate healing and belonging through creative expression, encourage help-seeking, equip youth to support their peers, and reduce stigma to normalize important conversations around suicide prevention and mental health. In pursuing our mission of youth-empowerment around mental health, we also seek to remind our participants that their experiences and feelings matter by allowing them to safely process emotions around current events and elevating voices that speak up for change. Youth that participate in our contests don’t just learn about mental health and suicide prevention - they also collaborate with peers, share their unique perspectives, and create films and art that reduce stigma and show those who are struggling that they aren’t alone. In doing so, these youth also learn first-hand how impactful their voices and their stories can be in shaping narratives around these topics; supporting inclusive communities where others feel seen, heard, and safe opening up to others; and providing much-needed sources of hope in these uncertain times. For our signature program, The Directing Change Film Contest, volunteer judges evaluate youth-created submissions on suicide prevention, mental health, and social justice each March . Participation in the program prepares youth to recognize signs of distress and seek help for themselves or a friend while inviting them to share their own unique message about suicide prevention and mental health with their peers. PSAs created for the contest are also used to raise awareness as part of media campaigns and outreach across California. All Youth Creating Change judging is completed remotely online and allows judges to participate flexibly at the time that works best for them. While the exact time required to evaluate submissions varies throughout the year, most judging periods require a time commitment of approximately 2 hours or less (not including a short orientation presentation which we also share with judges each spring). Forms are accepted on a rolling basis throughout the year, and you will receive a confirmation email with additional details once your form has been processed (depending on staff availability, this process may take several weeks). For Hope & Justice, judging occurs intermittently throughout the school year (typically the second week of each month). Youth across the state are invited to express their thoughts and feelings around critical mental health topics, as well as social justice and current events through the creation of visual art, written works, short films, audio PSAs, original music, and more. Participants can submit entries to the theme of "Hope," "Justice," or in response to an educational monthly prompt centered on mental health, healthy coping mechanisms, and available support resources. Judge Sign-Up Form: https://youthcreatingchange.org/become-a-judge/ Youth Creating Change Website: https://youthcreatingchange.org/ Directing Change Contest Site: https://directingchangeca.org/ Hope & Justice Contest Site: https://hopeandjustice.art/

Volunteers lead ice breakers, activities, facilitate discussions, and provide assistance to the Girls Empowerment Network program lead on-site. * Co-facilitate a weekly school group that takes place during the school day between 8AM-3PM and lasts for 1½ hours. * Co-facilitate a weekly afterschool group that takes place between the hours of 3PM-5:45PM and lasts for 2 hours. * Volunteers are assigned to a specific school in Central Texas and will be required to commit to the same time and day every week for the entirety of the semester. * * Girls Empowerment Network prefers that volunteers make a two-semester minimum commitment. Consistency is key for the girls we serve and we want to ensure that volunteers are able to commit to our programs and the girls they work with. * We anticipate that Fall 2025 semester programming will begin in September/early October. If you are interested/available to volunteer in-person each week with our Radiant G Circle program, Questions about this volunteer opportunity? Email kayleigh@girlsempowermentnetwork.org

name: Board Member Wanted
description: Active Plus has served the community by providing children with the necessary tools to live a healthy and active lifestyle. Our programs are led by top health educators and fitness instructors and focus on holistic health education. The combination of fitness and nutrition programs delivered in schools makes Active Plus is a unique and comprehensive force to drive improved results in the areas of classroom performance, childhood obesity, and a healthy lifestyle. Serve a two-year term on the Board to be eligible for re-appointment for one additional term. Attend all Board and committee or task force meetings as assigned, and special meetings as appropriate. (75% minimum attendance required). Board meetings will be held quarterly and committee meetings will be determined by committee members. * Support and promote the mission, goals, objectives, and initiatives of Active Plus. * Provides professional expertise and influence needed by Active Plus and/or represents one or more constituencies needed to provide balance to the Board’s membership. * Has demonstrated significant leadership capability in the community and is willing to provide that expertise to the operation of the Board and its committees. * Willing to make a personal financial contribution at a level that demonstrates commitment and sets a standard for others and is willing to ask others to give. * Able and willing to serve effectively as a public representative of the organization and involve others in the work of Active Plus. * Provide support and conduct an annual evaluation Active Plus’ mission statement is simple but is a full expression of our purpose and is the mantra that drives our everyday actions. Active Plus’ mission and core values are an integral part of the strategic plan and provide the foundation for the future. Our mission is to change lives by providing youth access to health and fitness education To serve as an active voting member of the legally constituted volunteer group which has authority and responsibility for the development of policies and continuing review of the conduct of the business of Active Plus. To raise funds to support the organization’s programs offered at Active Plus. Also, as a "working board member", partner with the Executive Director to fulfill management and technical functions as needed to be based on board members' expertise. * Promote the mission, goals, and objectives of Active Plus to increase public awareness, understanding and support of the organization. * A give or get of $5000. * Through personal resources or through the cultivation of new donor relationships, you are asked to set an annual goal of securing funds to support Active Plus. * Attend all Board and committee or task force meetings as assigned, and special meetings as appropriate. * Commit to serve on at least one standing committee or task force and to accept special assignments. * Attend all special activities of the Board, including fundraising events and such Board events or retreats as may be planned. * Spend time studying and evaluating issues to become informed and prepared to discuss and vote on issues facing Active Plus. Each board member is expected to vote their position after careful consideration of the issue. Tasks that will require preparation and a vote by Board members include: * Decisions on issues, policies, priorities, goals, and objectives; * Participation with other Board members and staff in the formulation, updating, and approval of long-range strategies and objectives; * Nomination and election of members and officers of the Board; * Monitoring and evaluation of the effectiveness of the projects and programs and assure these projects and programs are progressing toward achieving stated objectives; and, * Support the resolutions and actions of the Board of Directors irrespective of personal opinion as to any such resolution or action. * Assist the Board in carrying out its fiduciary responsibilities such as reviewing annual financial statements, budgets, and accounting practices * Assure a process is in place to select, employ, and periodically evaluate the performance of the * President/ Executive Director.

name: Join us in fighting nutrition insecurity in Berkeley & Albany!
requirements: Occasional 2-3 hour shifts as fits your schedule, or an ongoing commitment (preferred).

description: Berkeley Food Network is the largest food assistance organization in Northern Alameda County. At BFN, we believe everyone has the right to healthy food and we're committed to increasing food and nutrition security in Berkeley and Albany. We work collaboratively, sourcing high-quality, nutritious foods to distribute at no cost to our neighbors through a network of pantries, a Home Delivery program, and through partnerships with other organizations in our community. None of this work is possible without the hard work of our amazing volunteers! BFN offers a variety of volunteer opportunities. You can choose from 2-3 hour shifts doing the following: If you like interacting with all kinds of people in a vibrant environment, please join us! To get started, please fill out the inquiry form here: https://www.berkeleyfoodnetwork.org/get-involved/volunteer/ then watch a 20-minute Volunteer Orientation video here: bit.ly/3UcVocr This video provides an overview of of BFN’s mission, values, opportunities, and programs. * Pantry volunteer positions require watching an additional training video which provides a program overview, outline the variety of volunteer pantry roles, and presents the philosophies in our work with community members. Training will include customer service and de-escalation best practices, as well as approaches to serving members in the context of food insecurity.

name: Become a Clover!
requirements: If you like working with people, the days to be here are Tuesday, Thursday or Saturdays from 11am to 7pm.  If you like doing things on your own or want to learn equipment skills, come the other days as we are there working 7 days a week from 8am-8pm
Love of environment and love of people.
description: We are in constant need of volunteers to help people unload their vehicles, to educate them on proper recycling (without making them feel bad!), engaging family members that come to recycle with the driver (4 legged and 2 legged), and generally being a fun but educational place to go. Volunteer Clovers are either "people engagers", "equipment operators", or "clean up crew". We teach you everything you need to know, including how to safely operate our equipment. We are open to the public "every day with a T in it" so that's Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday from 11am-7pm, BUT we are prepping material for sale on the other days. So if you have the time, we have the need 7 days a week from 8am to 8pm! No experience necessary. Any age welcome...as long as you love people and recycling...this is the place to be! Can't wait to welcome you!
